qa_pairs.question: Where did Stephanie Jee grow up and what is her current profession?
qa_pairs.answer: Stephanie Jee is a native San Franciscan and she is a dentist practicing in the Sunset district.
qa_pairs.source_text: my name is Stephanie G um Im a native San Franciscan and Im a dentist and I practice out in the sunset

qa_pairs.question: What was the housing situation for Stephanie's family in 1966?
qa_pairs.answer: In 1966, Stephanie's family moved to a single-family home on 15th and Taraval after her grandmother gave her parents $7,000 for the down payment on a $32,000 house.
qa_pairs.source_text: in 1966 our family were my parents were expecting the third uh the fourth child and so my grandmother gave them seven thousand down for the down payment on a 32 000 home on 15th and Taraval

qa_pairs.question: What was the racial composition of Stephanie's neighborhood and school in the 1960s?
qa_pairs.answer: When Stephanie moved to the Sunset, there were only two other Asian families on her block, and at West Portal school, there were only 10 Asian kids in the whole school.
qa_pairs.source_text: when we moved there out to the sunset um then I started going to West Portal school when we lived on 15th Avenue in that single-family home there were two other Asian families on that block and I think back in the 60s there was more a sense of neighborhoods and and well playing with the kids who are on your block and so we all the Kids on the Block played with each other

qa_pairs.question: How did Stephanie feel about being a minority in her school and community?
qa_pairs.answer: Stephanie felt very much like a minority at West Portal school, where there were only 10 Asian kids, and her father emphasized that she needed to be better than everyone else to succeed.
qa_pairs.source_text: when I went to West Portal school there were only 10 Asian kids in the whole community in in the whole school and so I really did very much feel like a minority um and I do remember that my my dad always told me that the only way that I could succeed is if I was better than everyone else

qa_pairs.question: What historical housing discrimination did Stephanie learn about later in life?
qa_pairs.answer: Stephanie learned that there was a law that Asian people couldn't live in the Sunset and Parkside areas.
qa_pairs.source_text: I never knew that the reason why there werent so many Asians out in the sunset in the park side was that um there was a law that Asian people couldnt couldnt live there

qa_pairs.question: How did Stephanie acquire her dental practice and what challenges did she anticipate?
qa_pairs.answer: Stephanie purchased her dental practice from a white dentist and anticipated challenges because she was a woman and Asian, but the dentist trusted her and was open-minded.
qa_pairs.source_text: I ended up getting to practice out here in in the neighborhood that I grew up pretty much and even at that time um because I purchased the practice from a white dentist um I felt like there was going to be a problem because I was a woman and an Asian person that dentist took a liking to me and really trusted me

qa_pairs.question: What was unusual about Stephanie's home purchase in Forest Hill?
qa_pairs.answer: The seller of Stephanie's home in Forest Hill was Chinese and motivated to sell to her because she was also Chinese and a dentist.
qa_pairs.source_text: shortly after having my getting my practice here I purchased a home in Forest Hill and one thing that was really unusual about um purchasing that home was the the seller was actually living next door to this home in Forest Hill and was Chinese and so actually it was one of the first times in my life that being Asian being Chinese worked in my favor because he found out that I was Chinese and I was a dentist and so um I think he was pretty motivated to make the deal

qa_pairs.question: What changes in community dynamics does Stephanie observe in her neighborhood?
qa_pairs.answer: Stephanie observes that there is less sense of community now due to more working parents and the need for after-school care, unlike in the past when stay-at-home moms established community.
qa_pairs.source_text: I think as I said getting back to why theres not that sense of community is that you know I think more it has to do with that there are a lot of working parents and what kids do after school is totally different for instance Im a working parent and when my daughter was growing up I was constantly looking for after after school care and summer camps I was not home to entertain kids

qa_pairs.question: How has the affordability of housing in San Francisco changed over time according to Stephanie?
qa_pairs.answer: Stephanie notes that housing was more affordable in the past, allowing blue-collar workers like teachers and firefighters to own homes, but now it's much harder for the next generation to afford living in San Francisco.
qa_pairs.source_text: I think there were there was this ability for blue collar workers to afford homes out here so theyre almost everybody was a homeowner out here even you know the school teachers I have a number of school teacher families that on a two on a two school teacher salary some of these families own two homes was it unusual but now you know the teachers um come from far away and so the next generation is not able to live here unless they real they really would want to live here and some do actually scrape by and get very creative about financing to stay here but its not easy

qa_pairs.question: What does Stephanie suggest to help attract talent to San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: Stephanie suggests providing housing for city service workers like teachers, firefighters, and police to reduce the burden of living far away and attract good talent.
qa_pairs.source_text: I do think that for in certain sectors such as the teaching and the teaching the fire department the police department for City Services that they should have housing so so that the bird so that theres not so so much of a burden for for people to live so far away because I think um when you have um when you have this this Incredible cost to live here then youre not able to attract good talent
